DataElement.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Pain 2 Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of the degree of distress they experience related to their pain, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms._A question about the intensity of an individual's pain._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: A question about the intensity of an individual's pain.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about the intensity of an individual's pain.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Pain 2 Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (When I do have pain, it is very mild) to 5 (The pain I have is almost unbearable) on a Likert scale used on the Symptom Distress Scale questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: The pain I have is almost unbearable

ValueMeaning.preferredName: The pain I have is almost unbearable
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual's pain is or was almost unbearable.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual's pain is or was almost unbearable.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: The pain I have is very intense

ValueMeaning.preferredName: The pain I have is very intense
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual's pain is or was very intense.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual's pain is or was very intense.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: When I do have pain, it is usually fairly intense

ValueMeaning.preferredName: When I do have pain, it is usually fairly intense
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had pain, it was usually fairly intense.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had pain, it was usually fairly intense.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: When I do have pain, it is mildly distressing

ValueMeaning.preferredName: When I do have pain, it is mildly distressing
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had pain, was mildly distressing.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had pain, was mildly distressing.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: When I do have pain, it is very mild

ValueMeaning.preferredName: When I do have pain, it is very mild
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had pain, was very mild.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had pain, it was very mild.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SDS User's Manual
ReferenceDocuments.description: Documentation of the development, method of administration,  scoring procedures and psychometric properties of the SDS.
